description: Raul Jimenez scores in the 85th minute as Fulham extend West Ham United's winless run to seven games.

title: Burnley hold Everton to goalless draw
description: Burnley keep a clean sheet but still remain four points from safety in the Premier League table after a 0-0 draw with Everton.

title: Villa will not speak about league target until game 34 - Emery
description: Aston Villa manager Unai Emery insists it is still too early to say whether his side is in contention for the Premier League title despite being third in the table after their 2-1 victory against Chelsea.

title: 'Are you not entertained?' Why two-dayer was no less of a Test
description: BBC Sport chief cricket reporter Stephan Shemilt reflects on the chaos of the Boxing Day Test, which England won inside two days.

title: The best wonderkids outside big five leagues
description: There are plenty of wonderkids catching the eye outside of Europe's big-five leagues - BBC Sport takes a look at the top 10 as ranked by the CIES Football Observatory research group.

title: Small halls in crisis - boxing's lifeblood is struggling to breathe
description: Small-hall boxing has long been considered the sport's lifeblood. But right now, it is struggling for survival. BBC Sport finds out why.

title: Forest fulcrum Robertson - 'a talented, highly skilled, unbelievable outside-left'
description: John Robertson, who has died aged 72, was dubbed "the Picasso of football" and made Brian Clough's great Nottingham Forest side tick, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

title: The 25 best sports photos of 2025 - and the stories behind them
description: From the bottom of the swimming pool to the top of the pole vault bar, photographers reveal the stories behind these amazing shots. And a bonus point if you can spot the photographer in their own image.

title: Sitting with Ferguson and getting 'knocked out' - a photographer's tales
description: Magi Haroun, the first Premier League-accredited female photographer, shares her stories about sitting in the dugout with Sir Alex Ferguson and more.

title: Take on our BBC Gameshows ultimate football quiz
description: We've built five quizzes to celebrate five BBC shows - but only those with the biggest football trivia brains can beat them all.

title: Christopher Nolan's epic biopic starring Cillian Murphy
description: Watch the multi award-winning film on BBC iPlayer now

title: Booze, beach, beaten - how England lost the Ashes
description: BBC Sport chief cricket reporter Stephan Shemilt reveals the inside story of England's Ashes defeat in Australia on and off the pitch.

title: I've realised I can make a difference - Hoy
description: In a new BBC documentary, Sir Chris Hoy shows how he is using his Olympic mindset to reframe his purpose following a terminal cancer diagnosis.

title: The man behind the headlines - Salah, by Klopp, Diaz and more
description: BBC Sport explores Mohamed Salah's personality with help from the people who know him best.

title: Inside McLaren's season - the rules, values, incidents & relationships
description: Intra-team title battles turn toxic far more often than not. Andrew Benson analyses how McLaren have maintained relative harmony between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri.

title: England's AI World Cup masterplan - from perfecting penalties to powering players
description: BBC Sport hears from inside the England setup about how artificial intelligence is powering plans for next summer's World Cup.

title: 'Raise hell' - the fastest bowler you might not have heard of
description: The story of Duncan Spencer, the "frighteningly fast" bowler who could have played for England or Australia.

title: What next for friendly foes who see each other 'more than family'?
description: Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz have dominated men‚Äôs tennis in 2025. BBC Sport looks at the evolution of their growing rivalry ‚Äì and where it could go next.
